summary: Catching up with other TV shows..
body:
Catching up with other TV shows..

Finally out of the Outlander bubble, this weekend I’m binging Killing Eve and OMG that show is crazy. I love Sandra Oh (she’s the only reason I watched several seasons of Grey’s Anatomy), but Jodie Comer is absolutely fantastic 👏👏 I’m truly scared to watch some scenes 😬 one of the most sadistic and crazy villains I’ve ever seen.

Any other recommendation guys? 😁 As much as I love Outlander I can’t survive this long year only rewatching that show 😆

reblog.comment:

summary: WATCH: Killing Eve season two trailer
title: WATCH: Killing Eve season two trailer
body:
WATCH: Killing Eve season two trailer

The first trailer for the highly-anticipated second season of Killing Eve has dropped and it gives us a taste of what will surely be another thrilling ride.

The Guardianalso revealed the release date of the season in April this year. Since it premiered, the show has become one of the most watched series on BBC iPlayer and received critical acclaim, ending up on various lists of the best…

tags: not even trying to analyse its just another song fitting for them
bonus points for the poem ya feel
summary: Rewatching 1x03 of Killing Eve I realize I never really looked into the german poem that you can hear a man (Detlef Weinrich?)...
body:
Rewatching 1x03 of Killing Eve I realize I never really looked into the german poem that you can hear a man (Detlef Weinrich?) recite after Villanelle kills the chinese Colonel and leaves Hot Medica but the words “locken so dicht wie schwarzes moor” really stood to me so I wanted to see what this is about and:

“Durch dunkle Tannen
ganz von Sinnen
Von schwarzen Stämmen fest gestützt
Auf Schimmeln wie Blitze schnell
Am Horizont so gleich entrückt
Bleibt uns im Gedächtnis zwei Herren nur
mit langem Haar und Locken
so dicht wie schwarzes Moor.”  

which translates to:

“Through dark pine trees,
out of senses,
Tightly braced by black trunks 
On horses, fast as lightning
Enraptured by the horizon
In remembrance of two gentlemen
With long hair and curls
as dense as black moor.”   

In other words: dark romanticism aka

summary: Sounds of Concession
title: Sounds of Concession
description:
by Makepeace

Was Oksana even capable of love? Or just obsession? Perhaps her love presented itself in the form of obsession.

Either way, all they ever really had together was a subtle promise of the possibility of time.

Time to figure out why Eve couldn’t stop thinking about her and time to figure out why Oksana seemed so willing to trust Eve when she had no evidence to suggest that she should.

Words: 3172, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings

  • Relationships: Eve Polastri/Villanelle | Oksana Astankova
  • Additional Tags: Grief/Mourning, schrodinger’s villanelle, eve loves to monologue, niko is an ass

summary: Dude..... That mother/daughter thing that's going around here and Twitter is pissing me off. Like, I'm so mad and so fucking...
question: Dude..... That mother/daughter thing that's going around here and Twitter is pissing me off. Like, I'm so mad and so fucking worried at the same time... Because what if they actually go down that road... Like, can you even imagine that?? I really don't think that's gonna be the case, but then again he was a fucking consultant for the show. I mean, the fuck. I really need someone to reassure me that it's all bullshit and that it's  just NOT gonna happen lmao.
answer: Lmfaooooo I really don’t know why people are panicking about this like???? First of all, that interview is old. Not to mention, that man doesn’t write for the show lmfao. It’s been acknowledged time and time again from every WOMAN involved with the creation of the show that it’s sexual and obsessive between Eve and Villanelle. Idk about you but idk of any mothers and daughters that are sexually attracted to each other. If V was looking for a maternal figure, Phoebe would’ve made that clear in the first season but instead she had V tell Eve that she masturbates about her. Like….. not only that, but literally every new interview has Sandra saying how they’ll be testing the ‘romantic’ idea of Villaneve. She wouldn’t be saying this repeatedly if it wasn’t happening, Sandra goes too hard for Eve and V. This whole discussion stemmed from V looking at some flowers in the shape of the word ‘mum’ and it’s just such a reach to me. If anything, the show is probably trolling cause that’s the kind of thing they’d do tbh. I’m not worried in the slightest about any of this and you shouldn’t be either.
